Sentencas: One major challenge for the further development of solid oxide fuel cells is obtaining high-performance cathode materials with sufficient stability against reactions with CO2 present in the ambient atmosphere.
Titulo: Insights into the CO2 Stability-Performance Trade-Off of Antimony-Doped SrFeO3-δ Perovskite Cathode for Solid Oxide Fuel Cells

Sentencas: However, the enhanced stability is often achieved by using material systems exhibiting decreased performance metrics.
Titulo: Insights into the CO2 Stability-Performance Trade-Off of Antimony-Doped SrFeO3-δ Perovskite Cathode for Solid Oxide Fuel Cells

Sentencas: The phenomena underlying the performance and stability trade-off has not been well understood.
Titulo: Insights into the CO2 Stability-Performance Trade-Off of Antimony-Doped SrFeO3-δ Perovskite Cathode for Solid Oxide Fuel Cells

Sentencas: This paper uses antimony-doped SrFeO3-delta as a model material to shed light on the relationship between the structure, stability, and performance of perovskite-structured oxides which are commonly used as cathode materials.
Titulo: Insights into the CO2 Stability-Performance Trade-Off of Antimony-Doped SrFeO3-δ Perovskite Cathode for Solid Oxide Fuel Cells

Sentencas: X-ray absorption revealed that partial substitution of Fe by Sb leads to a series of changes in the local environment of the iron atom, such as a decrease in the iron oxidation state and increase in the oxygen coordination number.
Titulo: Insights into the CO2 Stability-Performance Trade-Off of Antimony-Doped SrFeO3-δ Perovskite Cathode for Solid Oxide Fuel Cells

Sentencas: Theoretical calculations show that the structural changes are associated with an increase in both the oxygen vacancy formation energy and metal-oxygen bond energy.
Titulo: Insights into the CO2 Stability-Performance Trade-Off of Antimony-Doped SrFeO3-δ Perovskite Cathode for Solid Oxide Fuel Cells

Sentencas: The area-specific resistance (ASR) of the perovskite oxide increases with Sb doping, indicating a deterioration of the oxygen reduction activity.
Titulo: Insights into the CO2 Stability-Performance Trade-Off of Antimony-Doped SrFeO3-δ Perovskite Cathode for Solid Oxide Fuel Cells

Sentencas: Exposure of the materials to CO2 leads to depressed oxygen desorption and an increased ASR, which becomes less pronounced at higher Sb doping levels.
Titulo: Insights into the CO2 Stability-Performance Trade-Off of Antimony-Doped SrFeO3-δ Perovskite Cathode for Solid Oxide Fuel Cells

Sentencas: Origin of the stability-performance trade-off is discussed based on the structural parameters.
Titulo: Insights into the CO2 Stability-Performance Trade-Off of Antimony-Doped SrFeO3-δ Perovskite Cathode for Solid Oxide Fuel Cells
